meanings.definition: A thing that is granted, especially in response to demands or as a privilege.
meanings.sent1: The company made a concession to the workers by increasing their lunch break.
meanings.sent2: The government made a concession to the protesters by lowering the taxes.
meanings.sent3: The concession of an extra day off was a pleasant surprise for the employees.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a concession to his charming personality.
meanings.sent5: The concession of free ice cream made the event even more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: The action of conceding or granting something.
meanings.sent1: The concession of the land to the community was a generous act.
meanings.sent2: His concession of defeat showed his sportsmanship.
meanings.sent3: The concession of the last piece of cake led to a playful food fight.
meanings.sent4: Her concession of the argument left him feeling victorious.
meanings.sent5: The concession of the trophy symbolized their hard work paying off.

meanings.definition: A space or privilege within certain premises for a subsidiary business or service.
meanings.sent1: The mall provided a concession for a small bookstore.
meanings.sent2: The stadium had a concession for selling snacks and drinks.
meanings.sent3: The concession for the new coffee shop was a hit among the office workers.
meanings.sent4: The concession for the arcade game corner attracted many kids.
meanings.sent5: The concession for the pet store added a cute touch to the shopping center.
